CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Violation of P1-1;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born on DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in LOC ( the “ FAC ” ) against ORG of ORG ) , seeking the recovery of unpaid salary .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed her claims and ordered the ORG to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL in compensation . On DATE and DATE , ORG paid the applicant ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL in execution of the judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG , seeking the full execution of the judgment of DATE . She also sought a declaration of unlawfulness as to the actions of ORG in deciding to join the pending writs of execution against the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected her claims as unsubstantiated . In particular the court found that the judgment of DATE could not be fully executed due to the lack of funds of the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( the “ ORG ” ) rejected the applicant ’s cassation appeal against the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s complaints with a view to instituting supervisory proceedings , lodged with the President of ORG , were rejected on DATE as being unsubstantiated .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that there were CARDINAL pending writs of execution that had been issued against ORG for a total sum of ORG . It also informed the applicant that insufficient funds were available to execute the decision . The applicant was invited to accept ORG CARDINAL in execution of the judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy President of ORG lodged a protest with the ORG of that court against the judgment of DATE of FAC . On DATE the Presidium of ORG quashed the decisions of DATE and DATE and remitted the case for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . During DATE the applicant received UAH CARDINAL as a result of enforcement measures of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claims as being unsubstantiated . On DATE ORG upheld that decision . In particular , it held that , if there are a number of execution proceedings pending against the same legal entity , these proceedings can be joined ( зведене виконавче провадження ) . It also informed the applicant that the partial enforcement of judgments authorised by ORG was lawful .
CARDINAL . At the time of lodging the application , the debt owed to the applicant amounted to UAH MONEY .
CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement proceedings were terminated due to the ORG ’s lack of funds .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the ORG that the judgment given in her favour remained unenforced .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the ORG that she had received the full amount of the debt due to her . She also confirmed that she had received an additional sum of ORG CARDINAL in compensation . On DATE the Government informed the ORG that the judgment had been enforced in full .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is set out in the judgment of DATE in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE ) .
